intro: Veprecella ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf veprecella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
